column2: ENGLISH

column1: # Attempt to improve relations with lord

column2: Improved Relations with Lord

During my stay at the court of a noble in [Root.Location.GetName], I have done my utmost to present my liege in a more favourable light and have him recognized as the benevolent and peaceful ruler [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is.
It seems as if I have succeeded!

During [From.GetHerHis] visit to my court, the [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has really convinced me of what a benevolent and peaceful ruler [From.GetHerHis] liege [From.Host.GetTitledName] is.
I feel a new appreciation for [From.Host.GetTitledName]!

column1: # The liege is informed of the success

column2:
My liege, my mission to [FromFrom.Location.GetName] has so far been a success! During my visit to the court of [From.GetBestName], I seem to have managed to make [From.GetHerHim] understand what a benevolent and peaceful ruler you really are and [From.GetSheHe] sends [From.GetHerHis] regards.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName]
Send a letter to inform my liege

column1: # Attempt to improve relations is sabotaged

column2: Sabotaged Relations with Lord

During my stay at the court of a noble in [Root.Location.GetName], I have done my utmost to present my liege in a more favourable light. But sinister forces around me seem to conspire to twist and turn my every action into something dubious and every word spoken into an insult.
It seems I have failed miserably...

During [From.GetHerHis] visit to my court, the [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has been going on and on about what a benevolent and peaceful ruler [From.GetHerHis] liege [From.Host.GetTitledName] is. But other members of the court have informed me of what a shameless and deceitful liar both [From.GetSheHe] and [From.GetHerHis] liege are.

During [From.GetHerHis] visit to my court, the [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has been going on and on about what a benevolent and peaceful ruler our liege [From.Host.GetTitledName] is. But other members of the court have informed me of what a shameless and deceitful liar both [From.GetSheHe] and our liege are.
This certainly won't increase my opinion of them!

My liege, I have tried to make [From.GetBestName] realize what a benevolent and peaceful ruler you really are, but sinister forces at [From.GetHerHis] court have been hard at work to discredit my every move and distort my every word. I am afraid that in the end the visit seems to have done more harm than good.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
Harm indeed...
Send a letter to inform my liege
Claim Fabricated
According to my liege's order, I have done my best to fabricate a claim on the title of a local landed noble in [Root.Location.GetName].
This better work...

column1: # The noble is informed about the claim

column2: It has come to my attention that the [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has bribed and threatened [From.GetHerHis] way through my domain trying to get enough people to recognize a claim on my title that [From.GetSheHe] has fabricated for [From.GetHerHis] liege, [From.Liege.GetTitledName].
They better not use it!
Send a letter to my liege

column1: # The liege is informed and has a choice to press the claim or not

column2:
My liege, my work in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] seems to have come to fruition. By bribing, cajoling, extorting, threatening and forging documents, I have managed to fabricate a claim on the [FromFrom.Location.County.GetFullName] presently held by [From.GetTitledName]. I leave it up to you whether to use it or not.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

My liege, my work in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] seem to have come to fruition. By bribing, cajoling, extorting, threatening and forging documents, I have managed to fabricate a claim on the [FromFrom.Location.Duchy.GetFullName] presently held by [From.GetTitledName]. I leave it up to you whether to press it or not.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

My liege, my work in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] seem to have come to fruition. By bribing, cajoling, extorting, threatening and forging documents, I have managed to fabricate a claim on the [FromFrom.Location.Kingdom.GetFullName] presently held by [From.GetTitledName]. I leave it up to you whether to press it or not.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Use it!
Let it go

column1: # The noble is informed if the claim is pressed, and is insulted

column2: [From.GetFullName] has decided to go ahead and use a claim on my title despite having nothing more than a laughable and obviously fabricated document to back it up.
That bastard!

column1: # A Noble finds out that the Chancellor is trying to fabricate claims

column2: Noble Infuriated
A local noble in [Root.Location.GetName] became suspicious after I asked a couple of brash questions and I fear he might have figured out that I am trying to fabricate a claim to his title!
I got a little careless
The noble knows...

column1: # The noble knows about the fabricated claims

column2: [From.Host.GetTitledName] is trying to usurp my title! [From.Host.GetHerHisCap] [Root.GetChancellorName] [From.GetTitledName] is supposedly traveling around [From.Location.GetName] trying to find both documents and supporters to help him legitimize a claim on the title. I need to do something about it!
Make him disappear...
An attempt on [This.GetHerHis] life is made
The assassination attempt fails
Try to bribe him
Send him an offer
I better let it be for now
The attempt to fabricate a claim on a title held by [From.GetTitledName] did not pass unnoticed, and rumors say that [From.GetSheHe] was so angry that [From.GetSheHe] ordered to have me assassinated.
I am not too worried...

column1: # Noble is informed that the assassination attempt succeeded

column2: The assassins succeeded! The troublesome [Root.GetChancellorName] who was roaming around the county trying to fabricate a claim on my title is no more... And there is no trace leading back to me.

column1: # The liege is informed about the Chancellor's death

column2: During a mission to try and fabricate a claim to a title in [From.Location.GetName], my [Root.GetChancellorName] has been murdered!
How terrible!

column1: # Noble is informed that the assassination attempt failed

column2: The assassins I sent failed miserably and the troublesome [FromFrom.GetMyChancellorName], [FromFrom.GetTitledName], continues his work to fabricate a claim on my title.
Damn!

It has come to my attention that your work in [Root.Location.GetName] is aimed to fabricate a claim on my title. This is of course unacceptable but I am willing to offer you a small contribution to encourage you to 'forget' about this for some time.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
I guess that could be arranged
Send [From.GetHerHim] a letter
I would never betray my liege!
Send the money back

column1: # Noble is informed that the Chancellor accepted the bribe

column2:
I have decided to accept your generous offer, and you can rest assure that I won't find anything that can be used to fabricate a claim within the next year...

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

column1: # Noble is informed that the Chancellor didn't accept the bribe

column2:
Your shameful attempt to bribe me has not been able to make the slightest dent in my moral armor and I am sending back the money. No matter the amount of gold, I could never be persuaded to betray my liege!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Damn him!

column1: # The Chancellor sows dissent between a local noble and his liege

column2: Vassal-Liege Opinion Lowered
It took all my skill and charm to sow distrust between a noble in [Root.Location.GetName] and his liege, but at last their relations lay in ruins.
This should please my liege!

column1: # The local noble start disliking his liege

column2: At first I could not believe it, but [From.GetTitledName] persisted and showed irrefutable evidence that my own liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] distrust and despises me!
What an insult!
Send an angry letter to [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]

column1: # The liege of the local noble is informed

column2: [From.GetTitledName] accused me of distrusting him and claimed to have evidence of my betrayal! I don't know where he have gotten these ideas from.
What an idiot!

column1: # The liege of the Chancellor is informed

column2:
My liege, I have managed to sow distrust between [From.GetTitledName] and [From.GetHerHis] liege [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]. I hope this pleases you.

Your humble [Root.GetMyChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
Fantastic!
[Root.GetMyChancellorName] Discovered

I have been sent to [From.Location.GetName] to secretly create unrest between the local nobles and their liege, but it seems that at least one of them has seen my real motive and I fear he might inform his liege about this, or even imprison me!.
Most worrisome...
A noble in [Root.Location.GetName] reacts

It seems that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has been hard at work in [From.Location.GetName] trying to spread unrest among us local nobles and turn us against my liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]. What should I do about this troublesome character?
Imprison [From.GetHerHim]!
This is [From.GetHerHis] liege's doing!
A letter is sent to my liege
[From.GetTitledName] completely overreacted to my most innocent visit to [From.Location.GetName] and decided to imprison me!
What will become of me now?

column1: # The Chancellor's liege is informed about imprisonment

column2:
My lord, your [Root.GetMyChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] tried to encourage me to turn against my liege [From.Liege.GetTitledName]! This shameless act can not go unpunished and to stop further interference I have thus decided to imprison your [Root.GetMyChancellorName] for an indefinite period of time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Outrageous!

column1: # The local noble informs his liege about imprisonment

column2:
My liege, I discovered that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [FromFrom.Liege.GetTitledName] has been agitating in [From.Location.GetName], trying to turn us local nobles against you. Rest assure that his poisonous word has had no effect on me, and to make sure no more harm is done, I have imprisoned him.

Your humble Vassal,
[From.GetTitledName]
[FromFrom.Liege.GetTitledName] will hear about this!

column1: # The Chancellor's liege is informed about the reaction of the noble

column2:
My lord, your [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has been trying to create unrest among the nobles in [From.Location.GetName] and tried to encourage me to turn against my liege [From.Liege.GetTitledName]! He failed miserably and I can assure you that this shameless act will not go by without consequences.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
This is not good...

column1: # The local noble informs his liege about the Chancellor's doing

column2:
My liege, I discovered that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [FromFrom.Liege.GetTitledName] has been agitating in [From.Location.GetName], trying to turn us local nobles against you. Rest assure that his poisonous word has had no effect on me.

Your humble Vassal,
[From.GetTitledName]
[FromFrom.Liege.GetTitledName] will hear about this!

column1: # The Chancellor's liege is informed about the reaction of the noble's liege

column2:
I have received word that your [Root.GetMyChancellorName] was trying to agitate the nobles of my realm by spreading lies about me in [FromFrom.Location.GetName]! Rest assure that this outrageous behavior will not stand!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Not what I had planned...

column1: # The Chancellor successfully increases the sentiment of the local clan

column2: An Honorable Mention
Most of the Clan elders are assembled in [Root.Location.GetName]. This is a golden opportunity to tell them about the great honor of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s clan...
Spin them such a tale...
What 'great honor'?

column1: # The liege is informed of the success

column2: My trusted [Root.GetChancellorName], [From.GetTitledFirstName], reports success from the Clan of [target_chief.Clan.GetBaseName]. Their elders now like the [Root.Clan.GetName] a lot better!
